Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: travelbug84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of March with my boyfriend after reading reviews on here. Overall, the hotel was very good, rooms were modern and very clean. We were given a room on the first floor which had views over the street and a large bathroom. Unfortunately, we found the noise from outside really loud! We have stayed in many large cities before without any effects on sleeping and expect traffic noise, but I honestly felt that we slept with the window open through the night. The hotel staff dealt with our concerns very well and offered us a room which faced the courtyard. This was quieter, although there was still noise from other doors slamming along the corridor. Rooms are well equiped with hairdryers, plenty of plug sockets, safe, wardrobe and the a good range of toiletries are provided. Breakfast was average, selection of fruit, cereals, yoghurts, pastries, bread, ham cheese etc. Was very busy at the weekend and would advise going down a bit earlier. Certainly enough to keep you going until lunch time. Location of the hotel was very good, short walk from Lepanto metro station, which connects you with other parts of Rome. We particularly enjoyed walking to the Vatican City with an ice cream at night, it's nice and quiet and looks lovely lit up. There are some nice restaurants in the local area, we found a selection as we walked to the Vatican City. There is a nice bar a few doors down from the hotel, it's on the corner of Via Cicerone and Piazza Cola di Rienzo. It was always busy day and night full of locals, it's a good place for a drink at any time of the day! I would still recommend this hotel, as it is a modern hotel for a good price (something which was difficult to find in Rome), just perhaps not to light sleepers!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: matthew789
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed here for 3 nights, loved every minute of it. the hotel is a fantastic location, very clean and modern, couldn't of asked for much more, a great place to come back and relax too. also at night we found it very quiet considering this is a major city. its surrounded by cafes, ice cream parlours and shops which seem to be a lot cheaper than those which are located on the other side of the bridge. we walked everywhere and found it fine, approx 10 minutes to the vatican, 15 too spanish steps and trevi fountain and 20-25 to the colosseum. would highly recommend getting tour guides at the vatican and the colosseum. 1.because you skip the queues 2. because you have no idea on where to start first! . felt extremely safe walking around rome at night, but like any city you should still be aware of whats going on and keep an eye open for pick pockets. there are a few beggar's and people trying to sell you stuff, which does get a bit annoying, but to be honest we didn't get troubled too much and you just have to firmly say no and carry on walking. just don't make eye contact in the first place! the food in rome is very pricey, tastes good but nothing special, just have to accept it. there is so much to do and see in rome, you are never going to see it all so we planned out what we wanted to see and spaced it out. if you try doing too much it becomes very stressful and you cant take any more information in. don't ruin your holiday! all in all we absolutely loved rome and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! twentyone hotel and Rome”
Reviews.Author: j199010
Reviews.Content: The twentyone hotel was perfect I couldn’t say a bad word about it. The hotel is well presented and rooms kept clean by the maids every day. The staff were very nice and polite, any questions you have they will help. Rooms are modern and well decorated, and equipped with everything you need. In the morning, there is a nice continental breakfast, everything thing you would expect from a four star hotel. Also located in the hotel is a small bar, this is good, and they serve food into the evening, or if you just want a drink. Checking in and out was very easy, they ask for your passport and card you booked with and make a copy when you check in. When you check out, you need to pay the city tax, this is around 3euors per night. The location is brilliant, you can walk to all the main sites and only ten min walk away from the Vatican city. The road the hotel is situated on, is full of shops, cafes and restaurants. Opposite the hotel, there is a ice cream and crepe shop, you must go there for a snack, also next to that is a cute café to grab a drink. All around the city you will find ice cream stands, it is the best ice cream I have ever tasted they are full of flavour and not to expensive. Food in Rome is general expensive, but you cant really avoid that. There are lots of baggers and people trying to sell you things, and all you can do I say no a walk away, some will accept that, but other will be forceful, but just keep walking. I recommend getting tours around the collosuim, Vatican and the roman ruins, you avoid the queues and have somebody to explain the history of Rome, it really does help make it more fascinating. Rome is a beautiful city, the people are well dressed and it is full of designer shops so bring plenty of money if you like shopping! From the airport to the hotel we used a shuttle bus service called consorzio airport shuttle bus, it’s a shared bus that goes to central hotels in Rome this only cost £24 for a round trip per person. We booked through expedia so I recommend this service. Rome and the twenty one hotel are fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel twenty one”
Reviews.Author: Nockster31
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel twenty one for the rugby weekend (Scotland v Italy). What a great hotel, location, rooms, service and staff. Everywhere is walk-able, the rooms were spotless and well equipped. The breakfast was a buffet and perfectly adequate. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: cynjeff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Rome, Italy, and the best part of the stay was the Twentyone Hotel. Just ask, and the staff will tell you how to get to anywhere that you want to go. It was my birthday, and I love the spa. The hotel staff suggested El Spa which is only a 5 minute walk, and it was wonderful. The hotel is in a very safe neighborhood, and as everyone has said, is right near the attractions and close to the metro. The hotel is clean, but the rooms are not as small as expected based on previous reviews. Our double faced Via Cola di Rienzo which has plenty of shops and restaurants, but best deals are with the street vendors right outside the hotel. The breakfast buffet (included) was plentiful but became very boring after a couple of days. The dinner buffet for 12 euro was also plentiful, but how many times can you eat bread and cold cuts? We also visited the Hard Rock Café, T-Bone Station, and McDonald’s for some American food and caught a bus from St. Peters Basilica to the Castel Romano Designer Outlet for 13 euro round-trip to get away from the crowds and for some less expensive designer shopping. My husband and I went everywhere...the Vatican City, the Sistine Chapel, St. Peters Basilica, the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, but rode an open-top bus to the Coliseum and the more distant sites. The open-top buses are right at the Vatican City. The WIFI sucks, and there were only three English channels. Then again, who goes to Rome to watch television? All in all, it was a great vacation, and having the Twentyone Hotel to come back to every night made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Miles R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the summer for three weeks for work. The staff were super friendly, rooms new and clean, the food fresh and plentiful each morning - happy to recommend this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crewsy
Reviews.Content: The hotels best selling point is the location. Walking distance to Vatican city (10 mins), st peters (15) Spanish steps (15),Trevi fountain (20), Colliseum (30). Staff were polite and very helpful with directions, Rooms were clean, WiFi in room ok not strong but good enough for signal on your mobile. Breakfast was ok, good enough to start the day, always plenty of tables in the dining room and plenty of food dont expect too many eggs or sausages but plenty of croissants, doughnuts and cereals. Overall a nice Hotel that i would recommend and would visit again if staying in Rome. This is a honest and my personal opinion of this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sunseekersarah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in early March after looking for somewhere close to the sights. The staff upon arrival were friendly however did not show much interaction after checking in. We had booked the junior suite with the jacuzzi which is VERY handy after spending a day walking around Rome. The room was nicely decorated and cleaned every day to a high standard. The breakfast was edible though there isn't a great variety of choice so I had italian ham rolls most days-not ideal but it was enough to get some energy for the day ahead. The best thing about this hotel is its location, we walked everywhere, in one direction you have the vatican city and in the other you have via del corso which will take you to all sights-trevi, pantheon, colosseum etc. At the end of the trip we decided that this is a very 'nice' hotel however it didn't really offer anything that made us fall for the hotel. Still for value and location I would consider another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bar, below par breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Deanray
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in good location, friendly helpfull staff and nice clean rooms. Bar staff where excellent and very helpfull and friendly and enjoyed using it as a starting point for our nights out. Bad....the breakfast was terrible and barely edible,only good thing was the tea and I made that myself. Fresh fruit consisted of off pineapple and some slices of orange and some cereal, yoghurt and mini frankfurt sausages and bread wrapped up the selection. Wifi was non exsistent in our room on the first floor and we had to goto reception to use it and even then it was very very very slow.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: VeryHappyPeople
Reviews.Content: As part of a group of 8 we stayed here for a friends birthday. What a great choice, the staff are so friendly and could not do enough for us. The whole hotel was very clean & welcoming, its position is great, near the Vatican and all the famous sites are a comfortable walk away + the metro station is nearby plenty of good restaurants & café/bars. Would we stay there again, you bet!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, with a great location for seeing the sights of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Craig_London10
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in a great location in northern Rome made for easy access to all the top sights of Rome. Rooms were clean and modern, if small. Staff were friendly and welcoming especially on reception. Hotel is modern, but not upmarket for a romantic break. It's selling point is location - close to the Vatican and the more opulent areas of northern Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellen in ever way!”
Reviews.Author: traceyapple
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, great location, clean rooms, great breakfast! Wifi was a bit hit and miss but I was on holiday so no real problem!

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel. Well located”
Reviews.Author: BigSteve_8
Reviews.Content: New hotel well located for exploring the city. Walkable to the major sites. Was very good value thanks to lastminute.com. No problems with temparature as per reviewer below but we did use the spare blanket in the wardrobe and adjust the in room thermostat! Very clean. Excellent bathroom with good shower. Staff very helpful Breakfast was continental with scrambelled eggs and sausages. What there was was nice without being spectacularly good. Bar in hotel is ordinary but we found an excellent one 50 yards away. (Il Piccolo Diavolo out of hotel turn right).

Reviews.Title: “FREEZING IN 21HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lila m
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big disappointment for us,that specific weekend the temperature in Rome was -4 and the hotel gave us to cover with sheets,not blanket not quilt but decoration sheets.The room was frozen and the air-condition was so noisy that we didn't slept for 2 nights and the air was not hot,we asked about a blanket and they gave us again sheets!! February with -4 and snow.Reception and breakfast area was frozen too,we ate on our jackets on a very poor breakfast unacceptable for 4* hotel.They ruined my weekend in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and ok”
Reviews.Author: bezkod
Reviews.Content: Hotels location is perfect for shopping and sightseeing, everything important is in a walking distance. The standard room was clean, nice and well equipped, but small - we had problems with placing of the second suitcase. The personnel at the reception were very very helpful and friendly, unlike the restaurant staff during breakfast. Breakfast was also ok, but its diversity could be better. Wifi was working but very weak in the room and I was never successful connecting to wifi in the restaurant. I didn't see any lobby space, except the sofa under the stairs on the ground floor - it was not a problem for us, but if you plan to spend much time in the hotel and get out of your small room, the only option is restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel within Walking Distance to Major Landmarks”
Reviews.Author: Justine C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here in December and absolutely loved it. The rooms are not very big, but are modern and kept very clean. The breakfast offered is very limited but sufficient. The location we found was amazing, we walked literally everywhere to the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish steps, the Vatican, the Sistine chapel and the Pantheon, it is a bit of a walk but Rome is just so beautiful that walking there just enables you to enjoy the city that much more! There are a number of "Hop on Hop Off" busses available as well. There are a number of restaurants you can choose from in the area which is great. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Rome and hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: nava s
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel - room was extremely small. We had 2 small suitcases and could not walk around the bed since the only place for the suitcases was on the floor by the bed. The room was not soundproff - we could hear the next door rooms door open and close late at night. When we asked to replace our room we were given an exterior room on the first floor - it was as if u were sleeping in the street!! This was not the value for the money we paid. Definitely not recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel for tourists”
Reviews.Author: t-kadir
Reviews.Content: Good location for sightseeing as could walk to most of key sights or to tour-bus pick-up points. Would recommend the trolley tour bus, as can hop on and off at key locations. Hotel room very modern and clean, but strangely dark. Breakfast adequate if you like cold meats and cheese. Bar staff very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Films overcharged”
Reviews.Author: Cinnabar
Reviews.Content: My brother and I had a great stay here. Room small but clean, breakfast had variety and quality. However, we watched two films on Sky, both were quoted on-screen as costing €2.50. On checkout we were charged €10 euro per film. We had no doubt the hotel were fully aware of this scam so just be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere and central location”
Reviews.Author: billywhizzy
Reviews.Content: Just arrived today from a 4 day trip to Rome. I went about on foot to all the major attractions and the Twenty one Hotel fits the job very well being just 900 mt from Vatican and 400mts from Piazza del Popolo. A 4 hour walk from there will take you to Piazza di Spagna, Pjazza Navona, Piazza Venezia, Fontana di Trevi, Pamtheon and Coleseum with ample time to spend a few minutes in all these places. The Hotel is very clean and modern and the staff were always friendly and salute you each time they see you. The breakfast was nothing to talk about with a few croixants scrambled eggs, sausages Ham and cheese selection etc but over all it served its purpose....ie: breakfast. The only snag is that the free WiFi offered is useless in the rooms and one has to get closer to the lifts to get a decent reception. A pity in these days of internet usage.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, modern and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: fred10e
Reviews.Content: Modern, new hotel, well located within walking distance of the historical centre but in a quieter and more interesting area (a living neighbourhood) to reside in. Very friendly staff. Breakfast could be better but there is a lot to eat and it's included in the rate. Don't miss Gelateria die Gracchi around the corner, one of the best in town!

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Camtfk
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay and would return. Nice rooms, great staff and convenient location. Food was nothing to brag about and kitchen staff were very aloof.

Reviews.Title: “Just a room with little value”
Reviews.Author: Cstuart1
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is the relatively convenient location. Staff were not warm at all, no engagement at all. Room was way too hot to sleep in even though it was cool outside. They decided to switch off the aircon because it started to get cool outside. When called, they said they could not do anything about it. We opened the window but could not sleep for the noise from the street. Worse holiday sleep ever for us. In addition, the family above had a child running at 6 in the morning. It took 3 complaints before one of the staff actually called that guest and then the running stopped. I wanted to thank the staff that took action and when I asked for his name, the front desk staff treated me with suspicion. When I finally found the staff to thank him, he seemed as well almost disdainful until he realised I wanted to thank him. Rooms definitely not sound proof. Breakfast was exactly the same every day. All they needed to do was to vary one item like the hot item.......to me it seemed like a very lazy approach to hotel business. Staff were never welcoming or smiling. No eye contact at all. Did not see any management presence. I guess they do not have to care seeing that Rome is usually always busy. The wireless facility in the room was useless.....never worked at all. Paint was peeling off the bathroom wall. There was a drainage smell from the bathroom. I will certainly not suggest this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bengt50
Reviews.Content: This well situated hotel promise high standards. But the fact is that the rooms are very small and very varm. When we stayed there the temperature outside was 22 degrees C. and the temperature in the room 30 degrees when we asked for help to cool down the room we where asked to open the window since the aircon. was turned of for the season??? The warm ? part of the breakfast rather poor scrambled eggs and slices of RAW hotdogs!!?? Try to find another hotel. Bengt from SWEDEN

Reviews.Title: “Good central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vanda9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary, the location was great really central. Unfortunately i had my purse stolen on the metro as soon as we got to Rome, my warning to all travellers BE CAREFUL!!! A young women with a baby (or not as we found out) unzipped my bag stole my purse and zipped it back up again i didnt feel a thing, although there was some nice local people who tried to warn us, these theives are professionals keep your hand on your zip/opening to your bag at all times!! When we got to the hotel the staff could not have been more helpful they were lovely and even found emergency numbers to cancel my credit cards etc as no cost, they even gave my partner some chocolates to perk him up!! The hotel was small but very clean and the staff could not help enough. They also gave us the name and location of a lovely restaurant not far from the hotel which was wonderfull. All in all the trip could have been spoilt by the theft of my purse however due to the prompt attention by the reception staff we had two glorious romantic nights. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaKur
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in September 2011, and found this hotel to be super convenient to sight-seeing, shopping, and restaurants. The room was clean with a stylish and modern decor, with well planned furnishings and amenities. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast, it had all of the basics plus some great fresh cheeses. We have stayed in this area many times previously at other 4 star properties and have found this hotel to have the best value for the prices charged.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very small & dark room”
Reviews.Author: mrmilo
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here as part of our Italian honeymoon - great location,can walk to the Vatican in one direction & to Piazza Navona in the opposite direction & very friendly & helpful reception staff.Our room was very small - with only onesmall window which did not appear to let any light in - the decor is all black which makes it darker.The bathroom carries on this theme - lack of storage & the shower cubicle looked a little grotty. Not the best beds in the world and a hidden mini bar under neath the desk produces an annoying glow & hum all through the night. Breakfast was very basic & served by quite a surly gentleman whom it was quite difficult to order any other form of coffee from expect the black treacly coffee served on the buffet. In all great hotel if you don't plan to spend much time in it - not a romantic hotel by any means & not 4 star - great for just sleeping .

Reviews.Title: “a good one”
Reviews.Author: Nina B
Reviews.Content: After leaving the taxi I could not find the door, strange (gray door that I had not seen)...Lobby is small ... beautiful corridors,nice furniture, spacious rooms but lack of light in them.. Breakfast not so much, lack of choice and space ( crowded, no matter did you came in seven or later). The staff friendly, and the location very central (short walk to the Vatican and Castello Angelo).

Reviews.Title: “A failed refurb attempt”
Reviews.Author: Gregoire W
Reviews.Content: So close, yet so far. The hotel has the mark of a good attempt to refurb an old hotel into a modern, boutique hotel, but the attempt was unsuccessful. The rooms are all in black with poor natural light and weak lightening, so that you find yourself fumbling around. The breakfast is weak and not worth your while. The soundproofing was not great and the beds not 4 star quality. However, the rooms are of good size, the price is good for Rome, the staff friendly, and the location very central (short walk to the Vatican and Castello Angelo). Have low expectations and be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Twenty-One Hotel in the Vatican area for two nights this past May. Our experience was very negative at this hotel and we will never stay here again. We checked in late so we were given a terrible room, and it must have been the handicap room because the shower in the bathroom didn’t have a barrior of any sort to retain the water when you shower (just a flat surface). In a matter of 12 seconds your bathroom was entirely flooded and within a few minutes it would have started to flood the rest of the hotel room. This is without a doubt the most ridiculous shower we have ever seen. I had to create a sponge barrier by using 16 towels so that the room wouldn’t flood after a 10 minute shower. When we complained to the front desk they looked at us like we were from outer space and not once did they say that they were sorry that our room wasn’t satisfactory. When we checked out of the hotel the front desk asked how our stay was. We told her why we were unhappy with the room and that they really shouldn’t rent that room out. Again she didn’t say that she was sorry that we didn’t enjoy our stay, instead she just gave us a blank stare. We will never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff need to take a course on customer service and the hotel tries to be “hip” and “modern” but they fail at it miserably! What a disaster!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Roma SoBe Style”
Reviews.Author: artfuladventures101
Reviews.Content: Twenty One - is a true 21st century hotel combing the best aspects of boutique hotels in South Beach and New York – functional, yet sexy. Good for business travelers, single tourists, young and older cool couples and tourist groups. This is a hip, comfortable hotel that is a great contrast to the journey back in time you take on Rome's streets. Its fantastic location is quiet but right in the middle of any direction you need to go on foot to for all the top tourist spots. The hang out spaces in the hotel are great and the patio decks are amazing. The rooms are smallish if you are used to large US hotels but they beautifully make use of space creating a seductive atmosphere with a luxurious bed, smoky glass wall between bedroom and bath, and some rooms have heavenly, in-room soaking tubs and others have generous outdoor breezy patios to enjoy cocktails in private or with friends before or after dinner. Breakfast is more than generous although coffee was less memorable compared to other Italian venues although that's sadly true of most Rome hotels who seem to cater to American tastes. Great hotel for groups especially with so many places to meet and hang out after a day of exhausting walks and filling your eyes. This is THE space for either socializing or relaxing and reflecting on the greatness of all that is Roma past and present.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel for a reasonable price for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dandy33
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel with air conditioning in Rome, near Vatican City. This hotel is situated about 4 blocks from Lepanto metro station. It has air conditioning for each room, although it seems to work in a strange way. The three icons (sun, neutral, and snow flake), which you use to select whether you would like the room to be heated or cooled, worked in reverse in our room. So, you would need to set it to sun (I assume sun=heating) to cool the room, and snow flake (=cool) to heat the room. Once we worked this out, the air conditioning (in late August) worked fantastically. The room is somewhat small, but what you would expect for such a large and popular city. The staff at reception were helpful when we asked about places to wash our laundry (self service) and for recommendations on places to eat. Our room was quiet, the breakfast was quite decent. The wifi was easy to use and worked well. Regarding the shower, there are two shower heads. One is the size of a dinner plate, and you need to press a button above the control to turn on the shower to use it. The second is smaller, and is manoeuvrable. I found that when I first used the shower that the second shower heard was pointed towards the door and was the first to come on! (and so it soaked all my clothes). So be careful! A good restaurant, nearby, was San Marco, on Via Tacito.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: berni75
Reviews.Content: Although centrally located with -funky comfortable interior the room was too hot(no air con operating)and with very subdued lighting.The buffet style breaskfast was poor so all in all not good value for money.We found the staff efficient if unwelcoming.The manager was unsympathetic and unwilling or unable to satisfy what we felt was a serious complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katzilie
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in 21 hotel for 4 nights in a double room. The hotel from the street view doesnt strike you as a beautiful, artistic hotel but when you go inside you start to change your mind. The corridors and the whole decoration of the hotel is very nice with large rooms and also large bathrooms with shower. It is located near the center (around 10-15 minute walk to navona and 5-10 minute to piazza popolo), that means that it is not in the awfully busy city center but very near it (if that is you want). It is on a central street full of shops, restaurants and everything you need to buy, leading to the Vatican city which is a 15-20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll go back”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Yvonne
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and professional personell; good situation only a short walk away from Piazza del Popolo; Modern, design, clean; nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Round”
Reviews.Author: colboy14
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be a great base for getting to see Rome.All the sights are within walking distance.Basic room not big but adequate and comfortable.Need to be down early for breakfast to get the best of whats on offer.Very clean and tidy with nice bathrooms and would recommend to couples looking for a good place in centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: swibee
Reviews.Content: It was actually June 2010 when I stayed there for 3 nights on a business trip. The room was not too big but spacious enough for single occupancy. The bathroom pretty modern with a great shower. Around the hotel are a lot of shops and restaurants and you can do and reach lots by foot. There weren't a lot of items to choose from for breakfast but for Italy absolutely okay. The hotel overall was very clean, so were the rooms and the staff was helpful and friendly. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: iseestars
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for a long weekend over his birthday. As it was a special occasion, we splashed out on a Junior Suite and it did not disappoint! The hotel is pretty non-eventful on the outside, but on a nice, busy street with lots of shops and restaurants. Inside, the staff are really friendly and it is beautifully contemporary - our room had a circular bed with a jacuzzi bath behind it. Trust me - if you're going to Rome for a short break, the jacuzzi is an absolute essential to relax and soothe achey muscles after hours of walking! Our view wasn't particularly great, (just over a residential street) but then we were so happy with how comfy, modern and clean our room was, we didn't mind. The only fault I had with our room was that the bathroom door didn't shut fully or lock either! Not so great when you're going away for a romantic break with a new partner! We were spoilt for choice in the morning for breakfast, although it was continental you could choose scrambled eggs, sausages (like the german hot dog type things) and tons of pastries, rolls, fruit and cereal to choose from. order your coffee from the waitress in the dining room - it's free and the filter coffee in the buffet area isn't so great. She'll get you nice cappuccinos instead! The hotel staff were really helpful at booking us taxis and recommending us restaurants. Everyone spoke perfect English in the hotel and we were very much made to feel welcome. I would definitely come back to Twentyone Hotel again and would recommend it to those travelling to Rome. Just see if you can stretch your money a bit further to get a suite room - the jacuzzi made all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well placed.”
Reviews.Author: sf1sf1sf1
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel which is well placed for all visits. The room had a view to die for and the staff were helpful and friendly. A great hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not soundproofed rooms”
Reviews.Author: amaze79
Reviews.Content: I really looked forward to staying at this hotel. I booked a room with a balcony. However its not very soundproofed, I could hear the nextdoor person cough. Woke up early cause of the cleaning personell was very looud. The room itself is stylish and with a nice bathroom. The location is good. Not so busy and crowded area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms but not great value”
Reviews.Author: HabsJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern and new, rooms are small but comfortable and tastefully decorated. It's walking distance to the Vatican and historical centre is just a short ride away (bus stop across the hotel or the train stop just 5 mins walk). Wifi is free which was great. Avoid the food there though. Breakfast was disappointing and not refilled - we went down at 9.30 (it goes on till 10.30) and almost everything was finished. We tried the hotel's restaurant for dinner one night and that was bad too. Staff are efficient and nice but the hotel is under-staffed so you have to wait for everything from being served at breakfast to having a taxi hailed for you, etc. It's still quite worth the stay - focus on the location and room quality, ignore the food and eat out.

Reviews.Title: “It was cute...”
Reviews.Author: travelerRN83
Reviews.Content: Like every other hotel in Europe, the room was a bit small. But, it was nice and had its mordern charm. I loved the dark-glass-walled bathroom. Close to Popolo Plaza, and Vatican City. Very nice neighborhood. The male concierge was very helpful. The females were a little bothered to answer questions. When I asked her for an Iron, she told me as per European law, no irons are allowed in hotels for fire safety. I have been to France and never heard of that, but I let it slide. The bar and restaurant are very nice, too. The lobby needs some work. All in all, I had a nice experience here and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & warm”
Reviews.Author: iason_82
Reviews.Content: A very stylish & hip hotel in an ancient city combining this diversity harmonically...However I would appreciate a spacier bathroom in this otherwise cute hotel. Well done to the helpful staff & especially to Nancy or Nadia (don't remember exactly the name!)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor value”
Reviews.Author: bigdom8
Reviews.Content: We paid £650ish for 3 nights and although the hotel is in a good location and the rooms are clean, I think that is about all there is to say. I thought the breakfast was disappointing and after day one just didn't bother- just a selection of chewy pastries, some plates of meats, a few chopped-up frankfurters, and some tea that looked very unappealing. I think we had the best room in the place; top floor, large corner balcony but there are no tables and chairs to sit out on the balcony with, the bathroom is so small we had to leave our toilet bags outside it, no bathrobes, no tea/coffee facility in the room, expensive minibar/roomservice and it took two reminders for the maintenance folks to fix the lightbulb over the shower so we showered in the dark for the first day. I felt the hotel was poor value for money when one can book a truly special place for just a little bit more. On the plus side, the hotel is very clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, and it is located about half-way between the Vatican and the major tourist areas of town.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT FOR EASTER”
Reviews.Author: Mansel_11
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel which is all black, grey and stainless steel. Not for people who like antiques but refreshing after all the curlicues and sculptures around you in Rome. Staff at reception are extremely helpful and involved and found us very good places to eat,produced umbrellas in a downpour,checked times of airport pickup for us and would print off boarding passes if you sent an email.Walking distance to Vatican City (very useful if you wanted to go there on Easter Sunday)and on two good bus routes We were given a disabled room-maybe we looked as though we needed it-only disadvantage was bathroom mirror quite low and the bedroom lighting was elegantly dim but hopeless for reading. The art in every room was grafitti style and in the corridors but I was never there long enough to read it. Breakfasts were fine but ask the waitress for coffee as the self service out of an urn tasted like it. we didn't eat there in the evening as they recommended a great local place and the 280 bus took us to the Trastevere on other nights

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - check out detailed review and pics”
Reviews.Author: chialeebrown
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Great boutique hotel at an unbeatable in central rome. Here are some pictures on my blog. http://bit.ly/eGPZ4v

Reviews.Title: “Good looks & location but poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: Andreas_Constantinou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel 21 for 2 nights on a romantic getaway in Rome. When we booked we thought we were getting an upmarket experience (we paid 170 euros per night for a double room) but ended up with very mixed feelings. The plus points: the hotel is 5 mins walk from piazza del popolo. Its impressively designed and decorated, and rooms are very clean. The minus points: we were given a noisy room almost at street level with a bathroom designed for disabled (no good for my wife who's pregnant) and water didnt properly drain which meant the water almost reached the room floor. The bed was hard - i travel every week and i have yet to get a sore back as i did here. Breakfast was really lousy - lowest grade ham and cheese plus limited choice of food. We got upgraded to a junior suite once we complained, but the overall experience is this hotel is run by management that care about the profits, not the guests

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, free wifi”
Reviews.Author: Kai R
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Twentyone Hotel for 5 nights. Regular hotel room was smallish (especially the bathroom), but very clean and comfortable. We had the nice view from the small window to the nearby plaza. Hotel is close to Vatican but also many other attractions (incl shopping streets). Same time it is not located in busy tourist area. Hotel has appr 300 channels, some Fox channels and CNN, BBC and other news channels also in English. Free wi-fi and also computer for those who don't have computer with them. The only really negative thing wass breakfast - really poor choice: just some white bread and stuff. But they make very good caffe latte and decent food for small dinner (if you are too tired to go out after the day in Vatican). One thing - as hotel is next to main street, it can be a bit noisy if windows are open. As airconditioning works only during summer, it was a bit too warm during the night, so we had to keep window open. It was value for money stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: richt1977
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at Hotel Twentyone, my girlfriend and myself decided to return to the hotel for our 3rd trip to the city as we like the location and it's good value for money compared to many other hotels. We have previously stayed near the main train terminal but felt the location of Hotel Twentyone was closer to most of the bigger attractions and generally a nicer area.Walk out the hotel and turn right and a 10 min walk takes you to the Vatican, turn left out of the hotel and you have Piazza del Popolo whichs leeds to the Via del Corsa off of which is the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. On the end of the Corsa is the Vittorio Emanuele building,, Musei Capitolini and the Colosseum, although this is probably a 25 min walk from the hotel. We had a double room on the 3rd floor, the room itself was modern and funky, not huge but more than you need for a city break.The en suite bathroom was ideal with a fantastic shower. The staff throughout our stay were excellent, helpful at all times and the breakfast has improved a great deal since our first stay 2 years ago. I spent a couple of hours online shopping around for deals and booked with Travelrepublic who were around 20% cheaper than everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, really enjoyed stay there.”
Reviews.Author: hill16lalala17
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice & helpfull staff, very clean room, great shower, sky tv, free wi-fi, would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Best cappuccino in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LondonFurby123
Reviews.Content: The rooms were tiny and the circular bed a little odd, but the decor and location was great. Breakfast and bar staff were fabulous. Breakfast wasn't all that nice but the cappuccinos were amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rishtt
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay and the rooms are excellent with a very modern design. Can't fault this hotel for anything although there could be a slightly wider choice for breakfast. Great location - only 5 minutes from metro and very close to the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Emmaelle73
Reviews.Content: Good location to visit Rome, nice staff, nice design room, The best of all is the low price! The less: it is not a 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: karafeeney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in mid-january, and overall was pleased with it. Very clean, and simple. Room has no coffee/tea making facilities however, and some of the walls are paper thin, so you can hear everything! Nicely designed and appealing. Average size room, enough for 2 people. Breakfast was rubbish..however as Rome has so many great eateries its not really a problem, and for the price its fair enough. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone who asked, and next time would stay in a suite!

Reviews.Title: “Italian Design Hotel, Best Location, Great Manageress...”
Reviews.Author: GregoryMeg
Reviews.Content: Wow! We were very lucky to `risk` and reserve our hotel thru internet. Very near to the Vatican, on a very good shopping street, with GOOD shops, very near to Popolo square and near Via dei Corso, very near to EVERYWHERE! Hotel is very stylish, minimal, black, grey and white are dominant colours, very VERY clean hotel, good staff but VERY helpful manageress called Rita who was so helpful with every query we had! Breakfast was VERY basic, very very basic and doesnt match to the image of the hotel, lobby is very small, but who cares when you are in Rome! I would definetely stay there again, again and again! Most important is that the rooms were so CLEAN! and trendy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Tourist197877
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced (we paid 109 euros per night with free b/fast and minibar) and in the perfect location. It was within easy walking distance of Vatican City, Castel Sant Angelo, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Colisseum, Roman Forum - almost all the sight in Rome. The subway was also within easy reach. The breakfast was fantastic, and the free minibar is a nice treat. The staff are very friendly. The rooms are very small, as is expected in Rome, but very clean and new. The free wifi reception was excellent in our room. We have fond memories of this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central”
Reviews.Author: Nafman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 days during the weekend, staff were nice and helpful, room was nice, well designed and new but a bit noisy as it was facing the road. Close walk to the Vatican and actually all important sites can be reached by foot. Last day there was a water leak filling the hallways , but i guess it is a rare occurrence and didn't bother us too much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and clean !”
Reviews.Author: JOGAB53
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended hotel ! Hotel has good location, near The Vatican.Hotel is clean and staff very nice and halpful. Breakfast was good. I will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, good location - I would stay again in there”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: Hi, After spending 3 weeks looking for a hotel in Rome I chose this one. I was visiting Rome for a few days and I booked it for me and some more friends. I made a good choice, it was like in the pictures, very clean, very nice, staff was friendly, was very modern, location was very good, only a short 3 minutes walk till the subway Lepanto. We had breakfast in there and it was plenty of food, continental breakfast, a very nice good coffee that you could ask separately free from the kitchen, breakfast was server for a few hours so it wasn't busy downstairs, you could find a table in the restaurant even if you were going later. Staff was friendly at the reception and in the restaurant too and also the cleaner was smiling and being very polite. We had dinner too in there and personnel was very polite and nice, we asked many things about Rome and they gave us information, dinner was also very nice and the wine the same. Prices at the restaurant were more than ok, at least in my opinion. It was raining and we were able to borrow free big umbrellas from the reception. Also we requested some adapter from the reception and we were given right away. Internet was working too, no problem with that. Bathroom was very nice, very warm inside, everything clean and modern. That was a big review, but I enjoyed my staying in there, Diana

Reviews.Title: “modern, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtravelers2
Reviews.Content: just returned for 7 day vacation to see the ancient areas of Rome and taste the food. Thought it impossible to find a clean and modern hotel in Rome until we found this hotel. Clean is most important to us and it did not disappoint us in this way. Although quite small, very modern & nice bathroom, shower. Room a bit too warm, even with the heat off. Opened window to cool. Not necessarily as walkable to sites as they say. The Vatican is the closet attraction with a good 10 minute walk. We used the metro to get around. Highly rec. buying the "Rome Passes" 2 free admits to museums and ride the buses, trolleys and trains all you want. Great deal for 3 days and only $25.00. Breakfast not so great but we expected this from reading reviews beforehand. Last day of our trip spent 4 hours on phone(Thank goodness we had "Skype") trying to confirm our prepaid ride back to airport next morning as they required. They hung up on us 3 times. Called Expedia and they hung up on them as well. Expedia was useless to help us. We ended up having the hotel order us a ride for 50 euros. A well dressed driver arrived in a very nice car. Don't try to drive yourself around there if you value your life. We were a little nervous on way back to airport, we were going close to 100 miles per hour! Seems like that is just how everyone drives there, very aggressive. Streets very busy hard to walk around so many people and I believe we went on an off season. Back to hotel.-If you are interested in a clean, modern hotel and a good value I would recommend the TwentyOne

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great base for weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Stevie1611
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights in September. The hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff were friendly. Good location - about 10 minute 10 walk to Vatican City where you can jump on a bus or one of the tour buses. The breakfast was satisfactory and the bar in the evening was a nice place to relax with a drink after dinner. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Please go and visit Trattoria Palazzaccio (think this is it's name - ask at reception) which is just around the corner. The food was absolutely amazing, and excellent value for money. Well worth a visit one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tric1003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel TwentyOne in Room 416 for 4 nights/5 days in September 2010. The room was spacious, clean, modern and with a comfortable bed. We had views over Via Cola Di Renza but no traffic noise. The only noise was from the room next door, if the occupants didn't have their TV on at full volume, there always seemed to be a huge crowd of people in the room. Other reviewers have complained about the mouldy smell in the bathroom which was also present in our room. We think it is because there is no ventilation in the bathroom - no window or fan - so propped the door open with a shoe. This did fix the problem somewhat but is an issue that the Hotel should permanently rectify. It is simply a case of bad execution for the sake of trendy design. The included breakfast was terrible. The food wasn't fresh and there were bugs buzzing around the meagre array of fruit. The coffee was OK. It would be better to go out and grab a coffee and brioche at a local cafe (standing up of course!). Of all the breakfast staff on duty, only 1 was cheerful and helpful. All the others tried really hard to pretend that they were busy doing other things - like talking to each other. The Front Desk Staff were efficient and whilst not overly friendly, were very helpful if any requests were made. We were able to book into the Galleria Borghese with less than 24 hours notice because the Concierge made a direct call on our behalf. The PC with free internet is very handy, and is located on Level 1 just outside the lifts. The location of the Hotel is great. Close to Lepanto Metro and easy walking distance to the Vatican, Castel St Angelo and Piazza del Popolo, walks along the Tiber etc. The Colosseum and "ancient Rome" are a bit further away but accessible by bus. We walked everywhere and caught the Metro where convenient. Definitely purchase a ROMA PASS which covers all modes of public transportation as well as gives you free entry to the 1st 2 museums/sights; and allows you to bypass the queues. Plus discounted entry to other sights. In addition Prati is a lovely neighborhood. It is leafy and stylish and has plenty of dining options. What we liked most about Prati is that it was away from the hustle and bustle of the crowds and noise in Rome, yet a short walk to the hustle and bustle when needed. The shopping on Via Cola Di Renzo is great with lots of big name stores, 2 department stores as well as a local produce market. There is a Billa supermarket in the basement of Coin Dept Store for those who like to buy their own supplies. If the Hotel could improve their breakfast and breakfast staff I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel given it's price and location.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it would be FAB but it was not”
Reviews.Author: myndychia
Reviews.Content: We were truly excited about our stay at hotel twentyone having paid 3x more of what we paid for our accomodation in florence. However we were deeply disappointed. First of all, the location of the hotel was not ideal. We visited the vatican for only one day and most other times found ourselves doing the 15-20 min walk to the other side of the river as the shops and restaurants there were a lot more interesting. The hotel is located on the same side as the vatican. I would recommend staying on the side of the trevi foundtain and spanish steps and most of the attractions restaurants and shops are on the other side. Secondly, service in the hotel was really stingy. Breakfast food when like pastries and fruit when depleted were not replaced. Also, the breads tasted stale and eggs consisted of miserable sliced hard boiled eggs and the fruit had fruit flies hovering above them. I felt sorry for myself when I sat at the breakfast table. There is much better fresher breakfast available for less than 1 euro if you venture out and find a cafe/deli. Thirdly, I realise from the reviews that if you were lucky enough to get allocated a large room than you would have had a pretty decent time. However, this hotel has many shoebox rooms. We were given one such hole in the wall which was so dark even with the lights on that I was unable to read my book. We asked for a rom change and they were happy to oblige but I can see how if I was stuck with the first room I would have hated my stay. Lastly, if you really must stay in this hotel I would highly recommend booking direct as booking through these online sites would slap a $80-90 premium per night on your accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Manager and Customer Service was ZERO”
Reviews.Author: victor747
Reviews.Content: The Manager there was very rude. She gave us the room on the second floor which was very noisy when asked if they can shift us to another room they said that we have to pay 40 Euros/night and I don't think that was worth it. The Manager was VERY VERY rude, she wanted money on everything, even if we needed umbrellas she asked for 5 Euros..RIDICULOUS. Even though it is nicely located but I won't recomment this hotel to anyone because of the customer service. Toiletries where not replaced everyday and we had to ask them 2 in our 4 day stay. Breakfast was not good at all and I will spent 20 Euros outside for a better breakfast. Due to the Manager's attitude I don't like to stay there.....

Reviews.Title: “Only Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luceyo83
Reviews.Content: Rooms: We had one on the first floor to the front, very noisy, could hear the traffic all night through the windows (which were very dirty). The room was spacious, but very dark. The bathroom is all black tiled so very dark in there too. The room was cleaned every day. No iron in the room and you had to pay 3 euro an item to get something ironed. Breakfast: Not a lot of choice and didnt seem to refill the trays. Hard to get a clean table, most mornings sat at dirty ones until they were cleared. The did give u tea and coffee very quickly when asked. Location: Good location to many sites. Also close to the Metro which was handy when coming and going to airport. Close to some lovely restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, impeccable”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel, clean. Family room was spacious for 2 adults and 2 teens, has 2 bathrooms, (a nice plus). Breakfast was basic, not much from where to choose. Front desk staff very attentive. Location is very convenient, walking distance to the Vatican and also to Spanish Square. If you like to walk, you can even walk to the Coliseum, it's far but possible. There are many restaurants on the same street and around the neighborhood, it's nice and very safe. The only thing that we didn't find was a mini mart or convenience store.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome, lovely neighbourhood, felt like locals”
Reviews.Author: SandalGirl21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Twentyone for 2 nights, arriving in Rome after travelling for over 24hrs from Australia they were kind enough to find a room ready for us straight away even though we arrived early in the morning. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is walking distance to The Vatican, Piazza Navona and Via del Corso, not to mention it is located on a main shopping strip also and close to a metro station. We stayed in a Deluxe Room which felt like a standard size hotel room, not as Deluxe as i would have liked, the rooms & bathrooms were decorated in a modern way and very clean. The room also had a huge outside terrace but no tables or chairs outside, so it was abit of a waste. I cant comment on breakfast as we went out to the little bar across the street for coffee & pastries which were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back again”
Reviews.Author: graincup
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here last summer. We stayed there for 5 nights. As far as a city center hotel is concerned, this is in a really good location. Its very modern interior is very clean and artistically executed. It is located about 5 minutes from an underground station. The staff are very friendly, and were helpful and courteous during our stay. The continental breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinOula_10
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through trip advisor at the last minute as our trip to rome was only organised a few hours before getting there :) last minute decision!!! :) even though we had n t looked it up a lot, the Hotel was very conveniet for our trip. The rooms were clean, beds and pillows very comfortable (looked forward laying down on them after all that walking). The breakfast was not that rich but good to eat and get you going and the staff was ok . Would recomend as the location of it is really good also , near to all the sightseeing ;) and only 5 mins away fron vatican city!!! Make sure you ask for a map from reception .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel * great price * great location nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: kriszty
Reviews.Content: I am one to research everything to death and after comparing so many hotels and reading slews of reviews i took a leap of faith on this hotel...i am soo happy we did. It was very modern and had a very upscale feel to it for a fraction of the price of one. People may complain or be bitter about piddly little things but if you can understand the difference of location and culture then you would see what a great value you are getting. Yes the rooms are smaller than in the U.S ..they dont have an ice machine in the hallway (gasp) ...you are getting a great room free breakfast free computer to use in the hallway with complimentary internet...As our special when we reserved they threw in a mini bar stacked full every day that was included for free...(make sure to ask since it was a special at the time) you even had a bidet for goodness sake lol..the AMAZING complimentary cappucino's for breakfast ALONE was worth it :) Sorry no eggs benedict with caviar for breakfast..however they provide a nice start to your day with assorted croissants and egg toast ect...felt very safe walking home at 3 am every night...very close to so many attractions.. the colosseum was the furthest south attractaction we went to and that was barely hitting the 2 mile mark..the vatican 1/2 a mile i believe ..a 5-10 min walk. Dont be scared off by reviews to stay here please well worth it..unless you are super high maintenence...then you wont be happy probably anywhere...

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great Location”
Reviews.Author: carcar47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Twentyone for 2 nights before getting on a cruise ship. We had 2 rooms, one was quite small with 2 twin beds, and the other was like a suite, 2 rooms, 2 baths, and a king size bed, strangely they were both the same price? We found this little hotel very clean, and staff very friendly and informative if you asked. English was well spoken. Bathrooms are all very new, the hotel is quite modern compared to the rest of the city. It was quiet , easy to sleep and comfortable bed. Breakfast was decent, if you got there early enough. No bacon and eggs, but a light start to the day type of thing. Included in the price of the room. We could walk everywhere, 5 mins to the vatican, and in the morning the streets were very walkable, and felt safe, but by mid day it was too hot to do anything. We tried the double decker bus which gets you around the whole city, to all the sites, but even that was stinking Hot. But when you only have a short time to see everything, it was a great way to so it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kyra2727
Reviews.Content: Teeny rooms, inconsistent A/C, warm minibar, bad location, unhelpful staff, uncomfortable beds, no drawers. Sorry I trusted the positive reviews on this site! Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “MOST AMAZING ROOM - MODERN AND CLEAN AND INEXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Erika G
Reviews.Content: You can pay 600E for a decent room in Rome (especially in the spring and summer months) but for much less, we stayed at Hotel Twentyone near the outskirts of central Rome (closer to the Vatican). After staying in some less-than-modern, less-than-clean hotels in France, we arrived in Rome in need of some tlc, which we absolutely got at Hotel Twentyone. The hotel offers free breakfast and free appetizers during the evenings; it also has a full bar. Make sure to check out Dal Toscano in the neighborhood with all the money you'll save at Hotel Twentyone. Oh, and they offer use of a lobby computer free with internet!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Marsbar66
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel we thought oh no what have we booked in to the curb appeal was definitely not there...but once we walked in to reception our fears were gone. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was roomy and nicely decorated. The hotel is walking distance to lots of major attractions and there are several restaurants and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Better choices in 4 Star accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Rowersdad
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a one night post cruise vacation, due to its proximity to the Vatican. This is a small hotel (footprint wise), with a modern look and feel. Common areas are non-existant, rooms are modern, albeit quite small with very limited storage space. Breakfast is below average and not up to par with other 4 star hotels in Rome. Beds are not as comfortable as they should be.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THROUGH LASTMINUTE.COM”
Reviews.Author: adp1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite nice, modern and clean. I had booked and paid for a deluxe room for 4 nights at Twenty One Hotel, Rome. Via LASTMINUTE.COM When I arrived the hotel had no record that the room was a deluxe room and had already been paid for. As it was late at night I took the standard room that they had and would discuss it in the morning. The following morning I had to have a 2 hour argument with the staff about my reservation. They would not believe that any money had been paid despite me showing them the Lastminute confirmation and booking voucher. I then had to call LM customer services - this took 34 minutes just to speak to someone. The operator (Amy) spoke to the hotel and I believe arranged for a e-mail confirming payment to be sent. The hotel was not prepared to do anything before receiving this e-mail, they were certainly not going to upgrade me to the room I had already paid for ! Later that day the hotel eventually conceded that a room had been paid for but this was only a standard room. I have complained to LastMinute, but they ahev still not resolved this and I have been waiting since 30th of April (2 Months) for a response !! I think the hotel could have been more helpful and contacted LastMinute on my behalf. But it seemed as I had chosen to use LM it was basically my fault. This whole nightmare spoilt our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline problem”
Reviews.Author: circumventor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and prepaid (of course). When I got to the Hotel they had my reservation but said it had not been prepaid. I had to pay again. It is now six weeks of trying to resolve this matter with Priceline to no avail. I don't know if the Hotel is the problem but Priceline only appears interested in stalling the matter. The Hotel was modern looking, which is rare for Rome. It was smallish, but comfortable. The staff were friendly but not always that efficient. For example, when we were leaving they said they called a cab. We waited ouside for our luggage for about 15 minutes. No cab. Went back in. They couldn't remember us and clearly hadn't called for a cab. I'm not sure I'd stay here again but I am sure I won't use Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely amazed how great this hotel was!!”
Reviews.Author: Si20brady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early June 2010 and for the money I was amazed! - friendly staff - sky tv - air con - modern / cool decorations - free internet - great buffet breakfast - amazingly good bathrooms and showers  - comfortable beds - quiet at night It’s a four star hotel easily and is as good as any similar rated hotel I have stayed at in the UK if not better! It was 10 minutes from Lepanto metro station and only a 15 minute walk straight to the Spanish steps. A nice area too with shops, places to eat n drink and fine to walk around late at night! Can’t say enough good things!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern city hotel -no public areas and awful breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: jil523
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Twentyone in Rome, the location is good on a shopping street on route to Vatican - felt safe to walk at night! Rooms small and dark decor with very small wardrobe (4 hangers only Ladies) no drawer space at all. no mirror at desk and no shelf in bathroom for toiletries. No restaurant , friendly bar staff but no customers. no outside area to sit. Easy to walk to all sights from hotel. Breakfast dreadful beware of the rubber scrambled egg and watered down juices. So if you want a handy Hotel and dont take many clothes and spend all your time sightseeing and like croissants- it wont matter .

Reviews.Title: “Molto Bene...Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: Hotellenny
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We came to Rome to celebrate my 60th Birthday. Coming from Florida, USA where I worl in the hotel industry, I was absolutely pleased beyong expectations. We stayed ten days. The room was very well appointed albeit small by US standards, but who comes to Italy to hang out in the room. It was perfectly clean, queen bed, funky headboard, beautiful window overlooking Via Cola Di Renzo and a great bathroom with a bidet. The toiletries were well stocked and of high quality. The hallways had interesting treatments, the elevators were always operable., the room was always spotless, the breakfast was more than adequate with eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, croissants and Cappucino SERVED by a waiter!!! And it was FREE. The employees were very gracious and helpful, the location was stupendous. We only took a cab twice and walked to every attraction and great restaurants. The Portofino Gelaterria across the street was excellent. Great shopping, fabulous gourmet shop (Franchi) right down the street. Pizza place around the corner etc. I could go on but suffice it to say, they made my birthday very special and we are returning in 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Listian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this nice hotel and were very satisfyed with our room (standard double). The breakfast buffet was simple but ok. The location of the hotel was better thann expected and we had free internet access at our room. The TV was very small and it only had tv-shop channels. If you want more than tv-shop you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “"Very Good!!"”
Reviews.Author: slebon
Reviews.Content: Very goo location and staff. We had a problem with the luggage and they help us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Snopy3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in our 3 days trip to Rome. Hotel has also advantages but also disdvantages, some of them big. 1. Lacation Hotel is well located for those who want to visit Vatican City, you can reach it in 15min by walk. Hotel is not so well located if you want to visit old town (Piazza Navona, Patheon etc.), from hotel is sth. about 30min by walk. You can use taxi but its expensive (sth about 9 EUR form hotel to Pantheon). We have had spend sth about 36 EUR daily for taxi :( 2. Room Rooms are VERY nice, well decorated, nic to stay in. Big plus for rooms. Cosy. Unfortunatelly hotel has a "patio" which is 3x3x3 square meter (VERY SMALL), so be advised to NOT BOOK room with "patio" view - rooms are dark (no sun light), and you are able to see very good your neighberhoods :( We did get one, but at the reception they didn't make problem to change the room. Second room we get was street view - nice, but pretty noisy at the night. 3. Staff Very nice and helpful, big plus! 4. Breakfast Not so good, poor choice. You can get scrambled eggs, some sausage and... thats all. Of course youghurt, croissant but no vegetables ( :() and only one sort of bred. But you can count for a really good coffe. 5. Other Plus for free internet. Minus for prices in minibar (10EUR per prosecco). Minus for a building (looking like built in '70, do not make you feel like in old city rome. SUMMARY Good value for money. But next time i would reserve other hotel. This one is good, but propably you can find better one, closer to city center. Avoid "patio view" rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous friendly staff, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sussexblondie
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 2 nights at this hotel but we would have quite happily stayed longer, and would definitely stay again if we return to Rome. It's in a great location - walking distance from Vatican, Trevi Fountain and many of the sites. The hotel itself is very modern, clean and comfortable. There is a supermarket just a short walk down the road if you need anything, and plenty of other shops too. The staff are so friendly and helpful, and made us feel very welcome on our first trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central and contemporary hotel...”
Reviews.Author: The_Brownster
Reviews.Content: Lovely central and contemporary hotel. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Great value for money and lovely warm rooms and aesthetically pleasing bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LovetheSun82London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Twentyone for 5 nights for my partners birthday in late January. After lots of searching around for a decent hotel which was reasonably priced and in a good location, we finally booked a double room here. The room was an adequate size and very nicely decorated. The bathroom was also great, with a large shower and plenty of hot water. I think that we could have done with more storage space, perhaps some drawers to but clothes in. After reading some of the reviews on here, i was pleasantly surprised with the breakfast. There was scrambled egg, rolls, croissants, fruit salads, ham and cheeses etc. The reception staff were helpful and all spoke perfect english. My partner is Italian and spoke to them in Italian most of the time. There is a nice pizza place over the road from the hotel and very handy if you wanted a quick bite to eat. Cola Di Rienzo is a very handy road to be based on. There are lots of different shops and used mainly by locals to do there shopping. The area in general is very quiet and you don't see many tourists hanging around. This area of Rome is very handy for the majority of sites. 5 mins up the road is Piazza De Popolo, 10 mins in the opposite direction is the Vatican. Saint Augustus Castel a 5 minute walk and old rome and all of the sites over the bridge from there. We didn't use public transport once and enjoyed walking around and seeing as much of Roma as we could in those 5 days. I would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great price for Rome”
Reviews.Author: goldm73
Reviews.Content: Stop looking around for a great place to stay in Rome. With Ares you can't go wrong. The hotel is convenientely located close to the metro station (walking distance) and the Rome nightlife. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly, particularly one men at reception, and all spoke excellent English. The rooms were clean, bright and comfortable, as were the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern design, rooms on the small side”
Reviews.Author: Hello-Ms-B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a deluxe room on the 5th floor. Room is modern, but definitely not as big as you'd expect from that category. The balcony however is fabulous (weather permitting). Nice view of St. Pieter, and a nice short walk to Via del Corso and the main attractions of the center. The room was missing a wall hook for a coat and there were no drawers for underwear etc. Bathroom nice, though little space for your toilettries. Why do they still put bidets in new buildings? Breakfast is nothing to write home about from a veggie's point of view. No fruit, no cereal, 1 plain yoghurt, no toast or bread apart from italian breadrolls. Still okay as there's jam, honey, cheese and sausage / scrambled eggs. We got a fabulous recommendation from the service for dinner: A regular Pizzeria / Trattoria around the corner: San Marco. Very enjoyable. Also reception was very helpful with storing the luggage and ordering taxis Nice job, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, how is this a 4 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: SussexPistolPete
Reviews.Content: This was our 30th Wedding Anniversary. Three days in Rome. We had called the hotel the previous week to put the trip back due to the weather conditions in England and we were unable to fly out. The manager `Cristian' in registration said he understood and would apply the first day charge to our next booking. We re-booked based on this conversation. €130 was charged to our card, but we were OK because this would be credited when we could get there the following week. We arrived to be told a mere 5% discount had been approved. We then had an upsetting first day while we waited to speak to the `alternative' manager. He refused to honour the agreement and said we did not have this in writing! We explained we would not have re-booked if we had known this. After more upset he finally allowed €60 off the bill, but this was done begrudgingly and was still less than half what had been promised. In short, we will never stay at this hotel again and we will be making sure we tell this story to as many people as we can. For €60 we had an upsetting start to our short stay. Further more, the breakfast was very limited and quite tedious. Overall we struggled to see how they have a 4 star rating. Leave aside the charging issue, the place is really quite average! Very disappointed! But, despite that we had a wonderful weekend in Rome when we were not at the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DBOnline
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Twenty One for 3 nights over christmas. The staff were very nice and helpful (unusual for Italy). As it was christmas we asked them to recommend a restaurant that would be open locally which we did. It was a decent choice Hotel is new and had the usual teething problems eg broken aitr conditioning. Rooms are lovely especially bathrooms. Great location, walkable to all the sights and a metro 5 minutes away. Breakfast was fine, usual buffet with great coffee Staff could so with some more local tips but otherwise a fantastic place in a beautiful city. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “nice and new”
Reviews.Author: nikomc2
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights to spend our Christmas vacations. The hotel looks new and modern, the staff speaks English and if you ask they give you a map which is very detailed and helpful with the small roads inside Rome. Rooms are not big but modern decorated and clean. The first room that we got was very small and the glass door of the bathroom did not firm to the door frame (it had a gap about 1,5 cm from the wall) so we asked and got another room (bigger) with smaller gap!! They don't changing towels and sheets every day. The breakfast buffet is small (coffee bread croissants juice omelet cake jam milk ) Internet is free and a public PC on the 1st floor. The location of the hotel is very good especially for shopping (Cola de Rienzo is a big shopping road) and walks to vatican, piazza del popolo and Trastevere. The metro Lepanto is 10 min walk distance from the hotel. Pay attention to the number on the road cause its easy to overpass the hotels entrance without notice it. Generally Rome is very nice, the prices on dinning and taxis are more expensive comparing to Greece (you ask for bottled mineral water and they bring you carafe with cold water, they can make it with gas also!! ) Do walk around the city cause it's full of attractions. Be aware that you walk a lot inside the airport and the Termini (train) station to get to the Metro. Taxis from airport to the city center costs 40 €, train from airport to termini costs 12€ (35 min)

Reviews.Title: “great location... excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarianelaSS
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located near the most historical sites and has a metro station on the outskirts. the interior is tastefully decorated and the staff are very friendly. can go to walk to the Vatican, which is great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: nikos74
Reviews.Content: 1)Very chic hotel, with really nice and spacious rooms.Modern decoration, great interior.The only negative aspect was that my room was on the 1st floor at the back side of the building and it was a little bit dark.Try upper floors. 2)Great and safe location, 5min. walk from Piazza del Popolo. Near metro station Lepanto. 3)Very friendly personnel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Joj0_9
Reviews.Content: Very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts basic. Rooms quite small but great location and rooms cleaned everyday. Would definately recommend it. Taxi rank just round the corner was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Hotel, cracking location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: flippajh
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day trip to Rome and booked after a day trawling through this website for hotels! Was not disappointed, the hotel is modern inside, not much to look at from outside and the staff were incredibly helpful. We arrived an hour early, but no problem checking in. Rooms were lovely, clean, minimalistic, free room safes, minibar and nice firm beds. Great location, about a 20 minute walk to the vatican/St Peters and totally walkable to the rest of the great attractions. Great restaurants in walkable reach. The reception staff even helped me book tickets on-line for the vatican museums and printed them out for me, nothing was too much trouble. Ok, breakfast wasn't amazing, but was certainly on a par with most of the free breakfasts I've had in Europe and you could have as much as you wanted. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and plan on booking Hotel Twentyone for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Room double booked and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: S2009London
Reviews.Content: Hotel Twentyone looked great online but sadly our experience completely changed our view. Do not stay here if you value customer service! Upon arrival we were finally informed (after hearing several fabricated excuses - air conditioning broken / entire floor being repaired) that our room had been double booked, despite the fact that we had received written confirmation of our booking and communicated with the hotel several times via email prior to arrival. The manager stated that there was absolutely nothing he could do and that he had booked us into similar quality hotel near the centre of town earlier in the day. This was quite simply a lie, as the hotel we were dropped off at in the taxi (paid for by the hotel) was in no way comparable with what we were expecting from Hotel Twentyone (see attached photos). In fact, it was of such poor quality it ruined our brief stay in Rome. As we were only staying in the city for 2 days we did not have time to return to Twentyone Hotel and demand alternative accommodation. However, we did email the management immediately upon arrival to request a more suitable alternative for the following night. Needless to say Twentyone Hotel failed to respond to this email and then claimed they had not received it until I asked an Italian speaker to telephone them on our behalf. Then mysteriously the email was found!
