The result was a token reduction in the rate we were due to pay at Hotel Twentyone and being informed that we would now have to settle our bill at the replacement hotel (as opposed to Hotel Twentyone settling the bill on our behalf as originally agreed) which conveniently prevented any further discussions on price / compensation. Twentyone Hotel appears to have a complete disregard for customer service and its management display an extremely arrogant attitude. Any decent hotel would ensure displaced guests are accommodated in an equivalent / higher quality establishment in the event of a booking mix up. The behaviour of the staff at this hotel ruined our stay, so choose somewhere else if you still want to enjoy your trip in the event of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nikostsepetis
Reviews.Content: Location is indeed great, away from the tourist neighbourhoods, still very near to everything. I had a deluxe room, it was very quiet (which is very appreciated) and clean. My room had no St Peters views or any other worth mentioning views and it was more on the small side. My friends who had the same category had a bigger room with great views. The decor is kind of trying hard to be trendy and the service was nothing to shout about (most of the Italians are anyway kind of tired with tourists!). The manager is very friendly and so is Andrea, the male receptionist, and most of the porters. The breakfast was bad, other that the good cappuccino (which is everywhere in this country) the quality of the products-cheese, bread, croissants etc-was low. All the above said i think the hotel is still a good option for someone visiting Rome and cannot afford to spend a fortune and stay in the great hotels like Hassler.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location - Will Definitely Return!!”
Reviews.Author: Yazzycat
Reviews.Content: I don't know where the people leaving 'negative' comments have been staying - but in my opinion, it can't have been this hotel!! Set in a beautiful 'high end' street in Rome - just a few minutes walk away from the Vatican and Castel St. Angelo in one direction; and Piazza del Popolo and the Spanish Steps in the other......with easy walkable access to the remainder of the main Rome attractions, even the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Yes, the hotel itself is one of the less pretty bulidings on the street - but it totally makes up for this once you set foot inside the marble and glass foyer; with, I found, really lovely staff - who speak impeccable English (I was disappointed at this, as I was wanting to try out my Italian)......who were professional and courteous at all times. We arrived at 12.00noon and actually got checked in and shown to our room right away - although, yes, 2.00p.m. check in is usual - and if you turn up early morning, it is likely (as it would be in any European Hotel) that you will be asked to return later! The rooms in the hotel were immaculate and exactly as shown on the hotel website - all very stylishly furnished in shades of black, white and grey with strong accent colours like lime green chairs and bright and colourful 'graffiti' art built into the headboards of the beds - Very FUNKY!! Bathrooms were beautifully clean also - tiled in black with white basin etc., and lots of chrome accents.....including a huge head 'rain' shower!! Lights in both the shower and the bathroom mirrors ensured that there was plenty of light for makeup application etc! Always plenty of hot water and beautifully white, fluffy towels - with lovely hotel branded toiletries. Yes, the beds are for those who like to sleep on a hard surface - but actually, after a day of walking around Rome - I was so wiped out I didn't notice what I was sleeping on! Breakfast, for a continental spread, I thought was pretty good - bearing in mind that the Italians start their day with pretty much a coffee and that's it! Buffet breakfast - with bottled water and two types of fruit juice; fruit salad (a mixture of tinned fruit with fresh melon and pineapple added); Croissants & Italian Pastries; Fresh Bread & Rolls; Cold Ham & Cheeses; Jams, Marmalades & Chocolate Spread (Italian version of Nutella); Panetone (Italian Cake) and Jam 'Tart'; as well as cereals and cold milk. The breakfast staff were all really lovely; and more than happy to take your orders for coffee of tea, just as you liked it!! This was my third visit to Rome; and the last time I was unfortunate enough to stay at Hotel De Petris - which I wouldn't send my worst enemy to!! However, I really do feel that I've now found a wonderful hidden gem of a hotel in Twentyone Hotel - and the next time I am in the Eternal City this is exactly where I will be staying! WONDERFUL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: alic2
Reviews.Content: The location is just fantastic. Felt very safe in this classy end of town. The room was the same size as I would expect in London or NY - so on the small side but very stylish and clean. The staff were great. All 10/10 If I had been asked by the hotel I would suggest they get mattress toppers to make the beds more comfortable - we normally sleep on a hard bed but this was solid..! Also the breakfast could be improved but just providing fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome chic hotel. Local but close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: ike301
Reviews.Content: Walk to Piazza Popolo. Walk to Vatican. This local tucked away hotel was perfect for us. No tourists roaming around, Metro was about 3 blocks away, lots of local eateries and shops (equals no markups!). Staff was actually pretty snobby, which was bad. Every answer was 'just taxi it'. But we wanted to do more local travel like walk or Metro - why not??? Couple of times, the ladies were snippy and gave us the impatient sighs as we asked questions. It's a stinking hotel, we don't live here, DUH. In room safe and inroom DSL - no wifi - u have to plug in. That was nice but the cords were a mess. Mini bar was nice and cold and stocked. Shower and bath were impeccable - large shower with rain shower head. Soap and shampoo were lush and fragrant. The decor was modern and chic. Flatscreen TV though most channels were not subscribed - why not help us out and set the channels to skip? It was torture to flip through 600 channels trying to find ones that work. Towels were awesome, place was clean, upbeat, had the nice trance music playing in the halls. Really felt like an mid to upscale NYC boutique hotel. Too bad the service was poor. Didn't like the snob fest in the lobby. Breakfast was included in a nice wing of the hotel with fresh cafe, meats, and foods.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, not so good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumFromSG
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights in August. We arrived fairly early in the morning and were told to come back at 2 pm which seems to be the standard operating procedure with most hotels in Europe. The blonde hair bell boy was extremely friendly, I couldn't really say the same for the counter staff. We got a map from the hotel which is better than the version you get with your Roma Pass. The hotel is walkable to the Vatican but its quite a distance so bring comfortable shoes. Piazza Navona is nearer for dinner in the evenings. The surroundings of the hotel is pretty sparse. A Supermarket is about a 10 min walk away if you need water and supplies for the hot Summer Heat. Its located at the basement of the Coin departmental store. We got the Jr Suite for our 3 days there. It was nice and big with a Jacuzzi behind the bed. The view was disappointing though. We stayed on the 4th floor and I could only a small courtyard and a tree. I'm not sure if thats because of the locations of the Jr. Suites. We had a buffet breakfast in our package but that was disappointing, the spread was dull. It took us about 1/2 a day to realize how big Rome is compared to Florence. So if you stay here, prepare to walk... a lot. I'd rather stay at a more central location around the Piazza Navona area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Price/Value not in balance”
Reviews.Author: LondonHotel5
Reviews.Content: I probably had too high expectations on the hotel because it was rated highly by tripadvisor and I normally trust the site 100%. However my instictual worry when looking at photos, namely that the hotel looks cold and souless, came true. Whilst the hotel website pictures look stunning, reality is that this is an ugly seventies building with small windows which has been turned into a hotel. the rooms on the upper floors might be great but a standard double room is on the lower floors, small and dark. The reception area is small too and no bar i cd find; We check-in early and were given a room which was a triple bedroom (101); however i felt claustrophobic and no daylight (the doublebed was on the end withput a window seperated from the single bed with a semi wall) made me depressed. Also the breakfast was distinctly unimpressive and all felt more like a upbeat hostel rather than a 4 star hotel. The hotel has its positives: location/ cleanliness/quiet (strong double glazed windows) and nice though small bathrooms (small showers and no tubes); but my expectations were far too high for what i got at the price of €159 (which was too much - for example stayed at the hotel rosso in florence the week before for €79 which was similar hotel but nicer building and half the price!).

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish hotel within walking distance to most tourist hot spots.”
Reviews.Author: NorthLondonCityGirl
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome at the beginning of May for a long bank holiday weekend break. When booking back in March, we knew that the hotel was new assuming that it was already taking bookings but, little did we realise that our arrival date was actually also the opening day!! Amongst the hotel staff "learning the ropes" and rooms being dressed, we managed to enjoy our stay with minimal disruption. The hotel itself is modern, with clean and well presented rooms - we were even treated to a complimentary bottle of bubbly in our room. Dinner service was not available during our time at the hotel but, continental breakfasts were provided and the service and quality was good. One thing worth mentioning, they do not offer irons or ironing boards to the rooms, so if you prefer non-creased clothing, I would recommend bringing your own travel iron. Storage is also limited, there were no drawers in our room only a wardrobe. This was fine for us since we were only staying 3 nights however, if you are planning to stay for longer I think you would still have to live out of your suitcase! The hotel is ideally located, we were able to walk every day to all the hot spots we wanted to visit without any aching limbs and for further out, a metro station is within 5-10 mins walk away. Enduring a short walk for dinner in the evenings was also pleasant-especially walking over the river tevere into Piazza del Popolo. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a central, contemporary place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: maryath
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel: recently inside renovated and modern. Excellent placement: near a metro station, walking distance of Piazza del Popolo, Via del Corso and Castel Sant' Angelo. Very nice neighborhood: cafe's, gelaterias and shops (especially useful was the Coin Supermarket).

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Marion04
Reviews.Content: Hotel Twenty One, Rome My husband and I spent a week in this hotel in May 2009. The hotel was first class and the location ideal for all sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NauticalCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel TwentyOne recently with my family and we found the staff friendly and the rooms very clean and confortable. The decor is uber trendy so if you like black and grey and cool bathroom fittings this is the place for you - not for those who prefer the more traditional. We though breakfast was great - not the cooked breakfast you would get in larger hotels but a good quality continental breakfast all the same and the coffee was freshly made and brougt to your table. The loaction is great - 5 mins from Piazza Popolo and a short walk to the Vatican. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you want 2 B COOL. Not exactly friendly or comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: GoGoGoGoGirl
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the haughty front desk staff. Not helpful, discouraged me from eating locally, but sent me to their buddy's place for dinner in Piazza Navona. Expensive, old fashioned cuisine. Instead try the fun fresh friendly Pizza San Marco 2 blocks away. It is way too cool here. I am an urban traveler and love an offbeat artsy hotel, but this one tries too hard. Blackboard art in the hallways and weirdly programmed rock music to accompany it. Oh, and only sconces, no lights in the room. Even hipsters need to read maps, right? If you brought a book, try the bathroom. It has the brightest light. Even the small desk in the room does not have a light. When I asked at the front desk if they had a small lamp, they squinted at me, "You want more light?". The only thing they could do was give me a room with 2 windows instead of one. A nice gesture, but not useful after sundown.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: MetallicaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the TwentyOne after travelling from Barcelona and Madrid. The staff in comparison, awesome. Location, awesome. Our room modern and clean with a lovely flat screen TV with the Sky network. Knowing that most European hotel rooms are not big I was very happy with our accomodations. The decor is very trendy and modern. Breakfast was good too. Nothing fancy but great coffee and continental bites. There is a Cafe, Pizzeria, and Gelato shop right across the street. It is within walking distance to a ton of restaurants and great shopping. The metro is a 5 minute walk away and can quickly get you to the Trevi Fountain in 3 stops, the Vatican in 1. Our first night we walked back from the Trevi Fountain. It was a long walk but we were in ROME! If you enjoy walking you can walk to all of the major attractions. We strapped on our Fit Flops and walked away. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel - not outstanding, but not at all bad either”
Reviews.Author: stevewynnerival
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Rome with my girlfriend 26-29 June and stayed at the Twentyone for 3 nights. I lived in Rome for 4 years so know the city well and have stayed in a lot of Italian hotels. For those of you that haven't - they are very hit and miss. Very. Its in a decent area on a nice street on Via Cola di Rienzo which isn't super exciting but it's very safe and pretty central. 5 mins walk to Piazza del Popolo and not far from the Vatican. It's 5 mins walk from Le Panto tube (on Linea A - two stops from the Vatican stop Ottaviano). Its a small but well formed hotel. Check-in was fine, but typically haphazard Italian. Their English is fine, but not brilliant. Got a room on the 4th floor (401) which was surprsingly small. We didn't care as we weren't there for the room but the bed is literally next to the door. The room was well decorated - no swirly carpets or duvets - and because its a new hotel, no smell of stale smoke. Bathroom is also quite small but again good for what we needed. Hot power shower, not bad toiletries but an extremely heavy door ! There's a mini bar/fridge which wasn't super cold, but never use the mini bar so couldn't care less. Can't comment on breakfast as we missed it (but it is included) on all 3 mornings (although on Monday morning that was thanks to our 0630 flight back to London!) Overall, if you're paying 100-110 Euro a night, its decent value but anything much more than that would be expensive. Its a no-frills boutique hotel. Nothing outstandingly brilliant, but also nothing at all bad or to complain about. As I say, compared to a lot of overpriced Rome hotels (a lot of them), its a good safe bet. Pros : Location, comfortable, modern decor Cons : Not a "full service" hotel, rooms a bit small

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - wrong booking - strange staff”
Reviews.Author: basenrobin
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in this hotel for one weekend. Reservation was made 2 months before arrival date, two days before arrival send an email to confirm again my booking and let them know we would arrive in the evening, this was no problem, confirmed. When we arrived the man at the lobby said we were te last ones who have booked a room (2 months ago??). No room available. They offered to pay for a cab and go to another hotel, same owner. Not amused. The boy was not able to show the other hotel, which was strange, so after a while I looked at it myself online. Luckily a women showed up, she was very very sorry for the inconvenience and made a deal to book a room in the other hotel with big discount. In the end that hotel (Stay Inn, which has recently been opened) was ok, location even better (city centre), poor poor breakfast but nice staff and nice rooms in great building. The way the boy treated us is killing for this hotels reputation, which is a pity, as I do believe the hotel has a lot of potential. I do hope we will see the Stay Inn in this list soon! Thanks to the woman who has helped us at the 21. The weekend turned out perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: GregElsa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the rooms too... if you like room with view avoid those that are not over the street... The location is quite good but you have to do some walking. Price was good too. But breakfast was not a 4 star according to my standards... although I was told that in Rome breakfast is not very rich!!!... And some tips for the neighborhood... across the street nearby the bus station is a pizza called "Pizza di Pazzi" (or something like this)... avoid it at any cost... even if you are dying... we paid 15euro for two slices of pizza and 2 beers... the pizza was cold and I put it in the garbage... the beers were warm... I don't know if he stole us at the pricing but the food was to be thrown away... in Thessaloniki we have much better pizzas than him!!! On the other corner of the road to the Vatican is a nice cafe-bar... with happy hours (with 5 euro you can eat buffet)... we found that on our last day!... It is also open until 2am, so you can go for a beer or a drink...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Avocetboy
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just returned from a two night stay and would highly recommend this hotel. From the outside, the hotel looks rather harsh and although it is brand new, it is a refurbishment of an old building, rather than a new build. Check in was quick and efficient and room allocated was exactly what we had booked, double deluxe on the 5th floor with a terrace. Room was cool and trendy with a very stylish fully tiled black bathroom. Well Stocked mini bar with reasonable prices, although we bought drinks from supermarket (doesnt everyone!!) Terrace was very large with views down the Via Del Rienzo towards St Peters Bassillica. The Hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Piazzo del Poppolo and from their we were able to visit all the major sites. 15 minute walk to Piazza Navona, 10 minutes to vatican city. Excellent take away Pizza place directly over the road who do an excellent cold tomato, mozerello, basil and rocket pizza. Perfect for an early evening snack with a cool peroni before venturing out to eat!! Only slight dissapointment was breakfast. Nothing really wrong with it, and freshly made coffees were good, but not a huge amount of choice, but maybe that is an italian breakfast rather than a criticism. I would definitely stay here again and having thrown my coin in the Trevi fountain, hopefully, I will.
